What is the significance of the v0.7.2 testnet in the Verus project?

The v0.7.2 testnet is a major milestone in the Verus project, featuring many new capabilities and blockchain firsts. It is considered the most groundbreaking testnet released by Verus so far, with the potential to improve and reshape the DeFi industry.

This is the most groundbreaking testnet the Verus project has ever released, and we believe it holds the potential to improve and reshape the DeFi industry. There are truly so many new capabilities and blockchain firsts working now on testnet that it’s hard to adequately cover them all. Below is a list of new capabilities active on the v0.7.2 testnet that will be on mainnet in the near future when considered fully hardened, tested, and ready for worldwide, public scale. Until then, Verus testnet is a fully decentralized blockchain network with 50% proof of work, 50% proof of stake, worldwide availability, and is running all of the new Verus protocols that are being tested and hardened for mainnet. All currencies and assets on the Verus testnet have absolutely no value and may be reset at any time in the interest of testing for mainnet. If you would like a representative basket of Verus testnet currencies that you can use to try out all of the new protocols from anywhere in the world, simply visit the Verus Discord and ask in the #pbaas-development channel. What are the characteristics of the Verus testnet?

The Verus testnet is a fully decentralized blockchain network with 50% proof of work and 50% proof of stake, available worldwide. It runs all new Verus protocols being tested and hardened for mainnet. Note that all currencies and assets on the Verus testnet have no value and may be reset at any time for testing purposes.

What does the DeFi and cross-currency liquidity integration with blockchain processing, fees, VerusID, and Verus PoP mean for the Verus platform?

This integration represents a massive set of platform capabilities that take DeFi further than any project in crypto today. It combines DeFi and cross-currency liquidity with blockchain processing, fees, VerusID, and Verus PoP, making it a powerful tool for decentralized finance. The implications of this integration are far-reaching and multifaceted, and will likely require time and exploration to fully understand.
